definition[0]: a big building where people wait to get onto planes, buses, or ships, or where goods are loaded
definition[1]: a piece of computer equipment consisting of at least a keyboard and a screen, that you use for putting in or taking out information from a large computer
definition[2]: one of the points at which you can connect wires in an electrical circuit
definition[3]: a terminal illness cannot be cured, and causes death
definition[4]: a large building that is part of an airport, bus station, or port, where people wait to get onto planes, buses, or ships
definition[5]: a piece of computer equipment that consists of a keyboard and a screen, used as part of a network of computers that are all connected to each other or to one large computer
example[3]: A PC can work as a terminal on a network.
